summary: This bill, the Constitutional Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act of 2025, aims to allow individuals with valid concealed carry permits to carry their handguns in other states, effectively establishing reciprocity. It outlines conditions, limitations, and the treatment of restricted licenses, specifying that individuals must comply with the same state and federal laws as resident permit holders. The bill also includes a severability clause and an effective date 90 days after enactment.
